verses.text: In the four hundred and eightieth year after the Israelites came out of Egypt, in the fourth year of Solomon's reign over Israel, in the month of Ziv (which is the second month), he began to build the house of the LORD.
verses.comment: Ziv is the ancient Hebrew name for the second month.

verses.text: The house which King Solomon built for the LORD was sixty cubits long, twenty cubits wide, and thirty cubits high.
verses.comment: A cubit is about 18 inches or 45 centimeters.

verses.text: The vestibule in front of the nave of the house was twenty cubits long, equal to the width of the house, and ten cubits deep in front of the house.
verses.comment: The 'nave' is the main room of the temple.

verses.text: He made windows for the house with narrow frames.
He built a structure against the wall of the house, running all around the walls of the house, both the nave and the inner sanctuary. And he made side chambers all around.
verses.comment: The side chambers were used for storage and other temple functions.

verses.text: The lowest story was five cubits wide, the middle was six cubits wide, and the third was seven cubits wide. For around the outside of the house he made offsets in the wall, so that the beams would not be inserted into the walls of the house.
verses.comment: Offsets prevent the beams of the side chambers from penetrating the temple's main walls.

verses.text: When the house was built, it was constructed with stone prepared at the quarry, so no hammer, axe, or any iron tool was heard in the house while it was being built.
verses.comment: All stones for the temple were cut and prepared offsite.

verses.text: The entrance to the lowest side chamber was on the south side of the house, and stairs led up to the middle and from the middle to the third level.
So he built the house and finished it, and he covered the house with beams and planks of cedar.
He built the side chambers against the whole house, each five cubits high, and they were joined to the house with beams of cedar.
Now the word of the LORD came to Solomon:

"Concerning this house that you are building, if you walk in my statutes and carry out my ordinances and keep all my commandments by walking in them, then I will establish my promise with you, which I spoke to David your father."
"And I will live among the Israelites and will not abandon my people Israel."
So Solomon built the house and finished it.

He lined the walls of the house’s interior with cedar boards, from the floor of the house up to the ceiling; he covered the interior with wood. And he lined the floor of the house with boards of cypress.
He built twenty cubits of the rear of the house with cedar boards from the floor to the walls; this is the inner sanctuary, the Most Holy Place.
verses.comment: The 'Most Holy Place' is also called the 'Holy of Holies.'

verses.text: The rest of the house, that is, the nave in front of the inner sanctuary, was forty cubits long.
The cedar inside the house had carvings of gourds and open flowers; all was cedar—no stone was visible.
verses.comment: Gourds are decorative carvings, as in ancient temple art.

verses.text: He prepared the inner sanctuary in the innermost part of the house to set there the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD.
The inner sanctuary was twenty cubits long, twenty cubits wide, and twenty cubits high. He overlaid it with pure gold and made an altar of cedar.
Solomon overlaid the interior of the house with pure gold, and he drew chains of gold across the front of the inner sanctuary and overlaid it with gold.
He overlaid the entire house with gold, until all the house was finished. Also, he overlaid with gold the entire altar that was by the inner sanctuary.
In the inner sanctuary he made two cherubim of olivewood, each ten cubits high.
verses.comment: Cherubim are angelic beings represented in art.

verses.text: One wing of the cherub was five cubits, and the other wing was five cubits—ten cubits from the tip of one wing to the tip of the other.
The other cherub was also ten cubits. Both cherubim were of the same size and shape.
The height of one cherub was ten cubits, so was the other cherub.
He set the cherubim inside the inner sanctuary, and their wings were spread out, so one wing of each touched the wall on one side, and their other wings touched each other in the middle of the room.
He overlaid the cherubim with gold.
He carved all the walls of the house all around with carved figures of cherubim, palm trees, and open flowers, both in the inner and outer rooms.
He overlaid the floor of the house with gold, both in the inner and outer rooms.
For the entrance into the inner sanctuary he made doors of olivewood. The lintel and doorposts had five sides.
verses.comment: "Five sides" refers to a pentagonal shape around the frame.

verses.text: He carved cherubim, palm trees, and open flowers on the doors, and overlaid them with gold, spread on the carved work.
In the same way he made doorposts of olivewood for the entrance to the main hall, four-sided.
He also made two doors of cypress wood; each door had two folding leaves. Both panels could fold.
He carved cherubim, palm trees, and open flowers on them, and overlaid them with gold fit exactly to the engraved work.
He built the inner courtyard with three courses of cut stone and one course of cedar beams.
In the fourth year, in the month of Ziv, the foundation of the house of the LORD was laid.
In the eleventh year, in the month of Bul (which is the eighth month), the house was finished in all its parts and in every detail. He built it in seven years.
verses.comment: Bul is the ancient Hebrew name for the eighth month.
